title: Marble Pumpkin Chocolate Bread Recipe
full_text:
Marble Pumpkin Chocolate Bread Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
60 mins
Active
20 mins
Cooling Time
45 mins
Total
115 mins
Serves
10
to 12 servings
Makes
1 loaf bread
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1 3/4
cup
(
12 1/4
ounce
)
granulated sugar
3/4
cup
canola oil
2
large
eggs
1 1/2
cups
(
12
ounces
)
canned pumpkin
1/4 plus 1/8
teaspoon
salt
2
cups
(
10
ounces
)
all-purpose flour
1/2
teaspoon
plus a
scant 1/8
teaspoon
baking soda
1 1/2
teaspoons
cinnamon
1/2
teaspoon
nutmeg
1/2
teaspoon
ground clove
3
tablespoons
cocoa powder
2
tablespoons
milk
Directions
Adjust oven rack to middle position and preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line an 8- by 4-inch loaf pan (see note) with parchment paper, allowing edges to overhang. Grease unlined part of pan.
Whisk sugar, oil, pumpkin, eggs, pumpkin, and salt in a large bowl until combined. Add flour, baking soda, cinnamon, nutmeg, and clove to the batter, and then whisk until completely combined.
Spoon 2 cups batter into pan. Spoon 1 cup batter into measuring cup and reserve.
Whisk cocoa and milk into remaining batter and spoon into pan. Using a butter knife or small offset spatula, swirl the batter a few times, lifting pumpkin batter from the bottom. Then spoon reserved pumpkin batter over the top and swirl a few times more (see note).
Bake until top is just set and skewer inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs, 60 to 75 minutes. Let cool in pan 45 minutes, then transfer to wire rack to cool completely.
Special Equipment
8- by 4-inch or 9- by 5-inch loaf pan
Notes
I like to use Williams Sonoma's Goldtouch 8- by 4-inch loaf pan. This recipe can be made in a 9- by 5-inch loaf pan, just decrease the baking time to 50 minutes. Avoid over-swirling the batter or it will become all chocolate.
